name: 楊元森
objective: This course teaches the basic computer programming skill using and its application to engineering problems. MATLAB is selected in this course. MATLAB is friendly for basic learners without programming background. It is not only a good starting point for students who want to learn more advanced programming languages such as C/C++ or Java, but also a friendly and powerful tools for practical engineers.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to MATLAB
Week 2: MATLAB Basic
Week 3: MATLAB Variables
Week 4: 2D plots
Week 5: Branching Statements
Week 6: Array / Vector / Matrix
Week 7: Loop
Week 8: Midterm simulation
Week 9: Midterm
Week 10: Loop advanced
Week 11: Loop advanced
Week 12: User defined functions 
Week 13: Sub-programs
Week 14: Arrays, structures, cells
Week 15: Handle Graphics
Week 16: Graphical User Interface Development
Week 17: Final exam. simulation
Week 18: Final exam.
materials:
S.J. Chapman,” MATLAB Programming with Applications for Engineers”, 1st Ed., Cengage Learning, Melbourne, Australia, 2012.
